Row.Text: Cavalaria com Carabina da União|Cavalarias com Carabina da União
Cavalaria com Carabina Confederada|Cavalarias com Carabina Confederadas
The basic melee unit of the Civil War. Upgrade Divisions into Corps for more concentrated firepower if you have unlocked the Military Science Tech and have the necessary Manpower and Gold available.
The most powerful melee unit of the Civil War, available only by upgrading an Infantry Division.
A unidade montada básica da Guerra Civil. Evolui para Cavalaria com Carabina depois de desbloquear a tecnologia de {TXT_KEY_CIVIL_WAR_SCENARIO_TECH_REPEATING_RIFLES_TITLE}.
A mais poderosa unidade montada da Guerra Civil.
The basic artillery unit of the Civil War. Very effective against nearby units.
Advanced artillery unit of the Civil War with a range of 3 hexes. Use for counter-battery fire on enemy artillery units.
The basic melee unit of the Civil War. Upgrade Divisions into Corps for more concentrated firepower if you have unlocked the Military Science Tech and have the necessary Manpower and Gold available.
The most powerful melee unit of the Civil War, available only by upgrading an Infantry Division.
A unidade montada básica da Guerra Civil. Evolui para Cavalaria com Carabina depois de desbloquear a tecnologia de {TXT_KEY_CIVIL_WAR_SCENARIO_TECH_REPEATING_RIFLES_TITLE}.
A mais poderosa unidade montada da Guerra Civil.
The basic artillery unit of the Civil War. Very effective against nearby units.
Advanced artillery unit of the Civil War with a range of 3 hexes. Use for counter-battery fire on enemy artillery units.
Basic naval unit, already outdated by the time of the Civil War. May only be built by the Union.
May only be built by the Confederate. Receive Gold for each Blockade Runner that is moved to the Eastern map edge (where it will be automatically disbanded).
May only be built by the Confederate. Slow but incredibly strong naval unit, able to easily defeat Union Frigates.
Ranged unit available late in the Civil War. Strong enough to resist melee attack and devastating to adjacent units.
May only be built by the Union. Able to easily defeat Confederate Blockade Runners and hold their own against Ironclads.
Front-line melee unit of the early Civil War, before both sides started organizing into larger units (Infantry Corps).
Front-line melee unit during the bulk of the Civil War, after both sides started organizing into larger units.
Unidade montada básica da Guerra Civil.
Poderosa unidade montada com o dobro da força de combate da cavalaria regular.
Basic artillery unit of the Civil War.
Advanced artillery unit with boosted range.
Front-line melee unit of the early Civil War, before both sides started organizing into larger units (Infantry Corps).
Front-line melee unit during the bulk of the Civil War, after both sides started organizing into larger units.
Unidade montada básica da Guerra Civil.
Poderosa unidade montada com o dobro da força de combate da cavalaria regular.
Basic artillery unit of the Civil War.
Advanced artillery unit with boosted range.
Confederate naval unit that can be exchanged for Gold.
Unique Confederate naval unit, devastating to Union Frigates.
Advanced anti-personnel weapon available late in the Civil War.
Unique Union naval unit, able to hold its own against Confederate Ironclads.
[COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]-20% de [ICON_STRENGTH]Força de Combate.[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Replaced with a randomly chosen new Confederate General (promotion) after the unit completes its first combat
[COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]-20% de [ICON_STRENGTH]Força de Combate.[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Replaced with a randomly chosen new Union General (promotion) after the unit completes its first combat

[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Dobro de movimento em {TXT_KEY_FEATURE_FOREST}.[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Venceu a "Corrida para Spotsylvania" em seu primeiro dia de comando no exército, marchando com as forças da União para aquela encruzilhada crítica.

[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Dobro de movimento em {TXT_KEY_TERRAIN_GRASS}.[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]A "Divisão Ligeira de Hill" era famosa por sua marcha de 17 milhas em um dia, de Harper's Ferry para salvar os confederados em Sharpsburg.
[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]+30% [ICON_STRENGTH] When defending in a city.[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]His South Carolinians fought well in the Battle of the Crater, capturing 130 prisoners.

[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]+15% de [ICON_STRENGTH] quando defendendo em terreno aberto.[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Ran for President against Lincoln in 1860. His division participated in the repulse of the Union frontal assault at Cold Harbor.
[COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]No bonus from Great Generals.[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]An accomplished general whose career was hampered by his frequent feuds with his superior officers.

[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]+30% de [ICON_STRENGTH] quando defendendo em {TXT_KEY_FEATURE_FOREST}.[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Sua divisão repeliu vários ataques da União na Batalha da Região Selvagem, fazendo com que Lee o considerasse para o comando do corpo.
[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]+10 HP per turn in enemy territory.[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Led a late war raid on Washington that almost succeeded in capturing the lightly-defended capital.

[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]+10 HP per turn outside of friendly and enemy territory.[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Led the Confederate advance into Pennsylvania and nearly captured Harrisburg during the Gettysburg campaign.
[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]+15% [ICON_STRENGTH] When attacking in open terrain.[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Helped keep Richmond secure with a fierce counterattack at the Battle of Deep Bottom.

[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]+30% de [ICON_STRENGTH] quando atacando em {TXT_KEY_FEATURE_FOREST}.[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Executou um ataque de flanco bem-sucedido na Terra Selvagem que poderia ter mudado o rumo da batalha se tivesse começado mais cedo no dia.
[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]+1 Visibility Range.[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Famed for his scouting expeditionary into Gettysburg looking for shoes that precipitated the great battle.

[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]+30% de [ICON_STRENGTH] ao atacar cidades.[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Captured a Union garrison of three thousand in his attack at Plymouth, North Carolina, the last Confederate victory of the war.
[COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]-1 Movement.[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]In his late fifties and suffering from memory loss, his principle assignment in the war was command of coastal garrisons.

[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]1 additional attack per turn.[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Perhaps the most aggressive of the Confederate commanders, his attacking style would ruin the Army of Tennessee late in the war.

[COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]-30% [ICON_STRENGTH] When defending in a city.[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Evacuated Norfolk early in the Peninsula Campaign, forcing the Confederates to scuttle the ironclad CSS Virginia.

[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Flanking Bonus increased by 50%.[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Nicknamed "Stonewall" at 1st Bull Run, he led decisive flanking maneuvers during the 2nd Bull Run and Chancellorsville campaigns.

[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]+30% [ICON_STRENGTH]When attacking in rough terrain.[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE][NEWLINE] His greatest success came leading the Confederate counterattack in the dense woods contested during the Wilderness campaign.

[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]+100% [ICON_STRENGTH] Quando defendendo em {TXT_KEY_FEATURE_MARSH[2]}.[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE][NEWLINE] Bluffed the Union into thinking he was leading a huge army while defending the marshlands of the Virginia Peninsula.

[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]30% stronger while fighting in the capital; bonus falls off as the unit gets further away.[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]The hero of the Battle of the Crater, an ill-fated Union attempt to tunnel under the siege lines defending Petersburg.

[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]+30% [ICON_STRENGTH] Quando defendendo em {TXT_KEY_TERRAIN_HILL[2]}.[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Spurred his troops on to a ferocious defense of Marye's Heights during the Battle of Fredericksburg.

[COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]-15% [ICON_STRENGTH] Quando atacando em terreno aberto.[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Gave his name to the ill-fated "Pickett's Charge" that led to the Confederate defeat on the third day of the Battle of Gettysburg.
[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Flanking Bonus increased by 30%.[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Commanded the first wave of Jackson's flank attack at Chancellorsville, helping create the legend of that general.

[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]+30% [ICON_STRENGTH] Combat Strength against artillery.[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Commanded units that succeeded in capturing the first Union artillery battery of the war (Rickett's battery at 1st Bull Run).
[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]+1 Movement.[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]His unit formed represented some of the elite "foot cavalry" of Jackson's corps, famed for their long daily marches.

[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Can embark onto Water Tiles.[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Part of a rare Confederate amphibious operation to reinforce Roanoke Island, North Carolina to defend it from Union assault.

[COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]No bonus from Great Generals.[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Granted command of the XI Corps due to his popularity with German immigrant recruits. Kept in side theaters whenever possible.
[COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]-1 Visibility Range.[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Thoroughly outmaneuvered and defeated by Stonewall Jackson during the 1862 Shenandoah Valley campaign.

[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]+30% [ICON_STRENGTH] When defending in rough terrain.[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Spurred his troops on to a ferocious defense of Henry House Hill during the 2nd Battle of Bull Run.

[COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]-15% de [ICON_STRENGTH] quando defendendo em terreno aberto.[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]His corps suffered disastrous losses in attacks he led at both Antietam and Fredericksburg.

[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]30% stronger while fighting in the capital; bonus falls off as the unit gets further away.[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]After mediocre results in field command, was assigned to lead the defenses of Washington for the balance of the war.

[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]+50% [ICON_STRENGTH] When defending in {TXT_KEY_FEATURE_MARSH}.[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Defended the Union right flank with a single corps against superior forces at the Battle of Gaines Mill.

[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Eliminates combat penalty for attacking from the sea or over a river.[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Led the one Union infantry unit that received special training on conducting amphibious operations.
[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]+30% [ICON_STRENGTH] When defending in a city.[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Successfully defended Harrisburg with lightly trained militia during the Gettysburg campaign.
[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]+30% de [ICON_STRENGTH] quando atacando em {TXT_KEY_FEATURE_FOREST}.[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Liderou um ataque ousado em West Woods em Antietam, no qual foi morto.
[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]+2 Visibility Range.[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]His troops found the infamous Special Order 191 (detailing Lee's Maryland invasion plans) rolled around three cigars.

[COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]-15% [ICON_STRENGTH] Combat Strength against infantry.[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Killed by a sharpshooter just moments after declaring that the Confederates "couldn't hit an elephant at this distance."

[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]+15% de [ICON_STRENGTH] quando defendendo em terreno aberto.[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Though most famous for his role in inventing baseball, he was a competent commander who performed admirably at Gettysburg.

[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]+30% de [ICON_STRENGTH] quando defendendo em terreno aberto.[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Organized the Union defense along Cemetery Ridge at Gettysburg after the death of his wing commander, John Reynolds.

[COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]-15% de [ICON_STRENGTH] quando defendendo em terreno aberto.[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Advanced his corps into the Peach Orchard at Gettysburg, leaving his units dangerously exposed to attacks from three sides.
[COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]-15% [ICON_STRENGTH] When defending in rough terrain.[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]His corps was routed in successive battles at Chancellorsville and Gettysburg in 1863.

[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]+30% de [ICON_STRENGTH] ao atacar um cidade.[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Although nicknamed "Slow Come" for his hesitant marching, his troops did capture Atlanta during Sherman's attack on that city.
[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]+15% [ICON_STRENGTH] When defending in rough terrain.[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Laid out the Union defenses at Gettysburg running along Cemetery Ridge to Little Round Top.
[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Embarked units defend at double strength.[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Planned and successfully executed the amphibious operation at Brown's Ferry during the Chattanooga campaign.

[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]+30% [ICON_STRENGTH] Quando atacando em {TXT_KEY_TERRAIN_HILL[2]}.[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Achieved the furthest advance of any Union unit during the assault on Marye's Heights above Fredericksburg.
[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]No Movement Cost to Pillage[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Led the Union VI Corps during Sheridan's Shenandoah Valley campaign that left that fertile farmland in ruin.

[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Dobro de movimento em {TXT_KEY_TERRAIN_GRASS}.[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Marched his corps 30 miles in 21 hours to support Sheridan in trapping Lee's army at Appomattox and ending the war in Virginia.
[COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]-1 Movement.[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Mustered out of service immediately after 1st Bull Run when he was blamed for not detaining Joe Johnston's army at Winchester.

[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]+30% [ICON_STRENGTH] Quando defendendo em {TXT_KEY_TERRAIN_HILL[2]}.[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Commander of the 20th Maine during their historic defense of Little Round Top during the second day at Gettysburg.

[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]+30% [ICON_STRENGTH] Combat Strength VS Fortified Units.[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Division included the 48th Pennsylvania, a unit of former coal miners expert at tunneling under enemy lines and planting explosives.

[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]+15% [ICON_STRENGTH] When attacking in open terrain.[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Pioneered a new style of attack using a massed column of troops that broke through enemy lines at Spotsylvania Court House.
